step1.para: With valves installed to protect seats, use a scraper and wire brush to remove deposits and gasket material from valve heads and gasket surface. Do not damage gasket surface of cylinder head.
Use a suitable solvent to remove dirt, grease, and deposits from removed parts.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields to protect eyes. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

step1.para: Clean all bolt holes, Make sure gasket surfaces, oil return, and coolant passages are clean. After rinsing thoroughly with hot water, dry with filtered compressed air. .

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, new head bolts and a new cylinder head gasket must be used when installing the cylinder head. Even if one bolt was removed, a new cylinder head gasket and new bolts are required.

step1.para: Clean all bolts (except head bolts) with a suitable solvent and dry thoroughly. New head bolts must be installed.

note.para: Dirt in threads or damaged threads may cause binding, resulting in a false torque reading.

step1.para: Use a Bottoming Tap (metric) to clean each tapped hole in crankcase top deck. Remove debris with filtered compressed air.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, always replace head bolts when installing the cylinder head. Even if you are removing only one bolt, it will be necessary to replace the cylinder head gasket and all cylinder head bolts.
Do not use antiseize compound, grease, or any other lubricant except clean engine oil. Other lubricants have an adverse effect on torque results.

step1.para: Thoroughly clean each push rod using a suitable solvent. Dry using filtered compressed air .
